{"step_by_step_thinking": "The first step in the management of a woman with a history of primary infertility and bilateral tubal block is to evaluate the cause of the tubal block. In this case, the tubal block is seen at the cornu on hysterosalpingogram. The next step would be to perform a laparoscopy and hysteroscopy to further evaluate the tubal block and assess the condition of the uterus and fallopian tubes. This will help determine if there are any other factors contributing to the infertility. Based on the findings during the laparoscopy and hysteroscopy, further management options can be considered. Therefore, the correct answer is B. Laparoscopy and hysteroscopy.", "answer_choice": "B"}
